p: NS2A (~22 kDa) is a small hydrophobic integral membrane protein that has been implicated in viral RNA synthesis, viral particle assembly ( Xie et al., 2013). NS2A is an essential component of the replicase and also an inhibitor of interferon (IFN) production. Two forms of this protein (NS2A and NS2Aa) are observed as a result of an internal cleavage by the viral NS2B–NS3 protease. This suggests a physical interaction between NS2A and NS3. Interactions between NS2A and NS5 and with RNA transcripts of the 3′ UTR have also been suggested ( Lindenbach et al., 2007).
